title: 21.4 Analysis of Union by Rank with Path Compression
content:
Section 21.4

Analysis of Union by Rank with Path Compression

Summary

Proving the nearly-constant amortized bound using Ackermann function.

Key Points

  • α(n) = inverse Ackermann function, grows incredibly slowly
  • α(n) ≤ 4 for all practical values of n (up to 10^80)
  • Amortized time per operation: O(α(n))
  • Proof uses potential function based on ranks
  • Tight bound: Ω(α(n)) per operation

Example

For n = 10^80 (more than atoms in universe), α(n) = 4. Effectively constant!

Why It Matters

One of the most efficient data structures known - practically O(1).
